website_summaries.verdict: Delivers many of the best features of the original Mighty Mite model with special pet hair attachments.
pros: Includes a strong HEPA filter to capture a high level of dust and pet dander
Will give you a 20-foot power cord, so you can work in a wide area
Includes a telescoping wand and a crevice tool to help clean pet hair more efficiently
Available in three colors of blue, yellow, or purple
cons: Higher price than model without pet features
Works better on hard floors than carpet

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum, AWFUL hose.
customer_reviews.text: So, this is a mixed bag. The canister vacuum is awesome for pet hair on wood and tile floors. The pet attachment for furniture is great. But the hose... OMG what a piece of junk. It is made of plastic and it came out of the box already kinked in 2 places. If you keep the hose straight, it's great. But try and keep a hose straight when you are actually using the vacuum. A replacement costs between 25 and 35 dollars. So to have a good vacuum, I will end up paying over a hundred dollars after replacing the hose.
customer_reviews.author: David Kinnaird

customer_reviews.title: 😳The hose doesn't work. It's a total joke!
customer_reviews.text: 😳 I am extremely disappointed in the hose on this vacuum. It doesn't work. It collapses in on itself while I use it as though it's made out of flimsy single layered silk fabric. I can't believe they think this is okay to sell. It's completely unusable. The canister works just fine, they just need to include a real hose that actually works. It's such a total joke!
customer_reviews.author: ~Alex~

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this vac; its not what it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Mighty Mite vacs over the years. Its attraction has been a light weight, easy to use vacuum. This new one is a mess. The plastic flexible hose is so thin it kinks up all the time. The new telescoping wand is very heavy metal and hard to manage. The add on dust filter looks like it will clog up in no time and the machine is very noisy. The attachments are also cumbersome. Someone has ruined a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clogs at the angle in the tube
customer_reviews.text: The "elbow" angle is awful. I end up with it clogging there almost every time I use this vacuum and end up having to use a vent brush to clear it out. For a vacuum that is supposedly for pet clean up, it's inability to handle cat hair without clogging is a major fail. IMO this is a waste of money. They could have rounded that angle so that it doesn't cause that problem, but it's a relatively sharp angle, so it clogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kili

customer_reviews.title: I'm a professional housekeeper. This is the vacuum we use.
customer_reviews.text: As a professional housekeeper I can tell you this is the best vacuum. This vacuum is what our company uses to clean homes. Loved it so much I bought one for myself. Though I do not like the head that it came with. I bought the Eureka fit's all elbow head separately (under $10). Works so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for pets with long hair!
customer_reviews.text: Be wary if your pet has long, course hair! This is the second day I have used Pet Lover vacuum and the pet attachment will not budge. I have less than 500 square foot of carpet, so this is simply unacceptable. I had to disassemble the attachment using a screwdriver just to get some of the hair from under the belt and rotor. I will include pictures to give a better idea of how small the attachment actually is, and how despite the power, it is inefficient at removing my dog's hair. He is an Australian Shepherd, by the way. I don't consider that extremely course hair to cause such an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Mines

customer_reviews.title: Don't even.....
customer_reviews.text: This so called vacuum is so poorly designed with the cheapest of materials I don't even know where to begin with all of the issues I have with it. The hose constantly and I mean CONSTANTLY folds over on itself causing it to kink despite having a rotating connector piece that is supposed to prevent this from happening. The telescoping handle is ridiculous. The mechanism to adjust the handle length is at the base of the arm making you have to stop working to bend down to adjust it. In my opinion, this product isn't even worthy of being a toy for my grandchildren. You get what you pay for - lesson learned -
customer_reviews.author: Karey Wells

customer_reviews.title: Dislike! The suction is descent but loud
customer_reviews.text: Dislike! The suction is descent but loud. What I dislike so much about this vacuum is the hose. After a few uses the hose wouldn’t freely turn at the base as you move which causes the hose to kink and stops the suction and makes a very loud noise. As you vacuum you are continually stopping to unkink the hose and turn it manually. Very annoying! It seems to be a defect. I plan to contact Amazon for possible exchange for a Kenmore which I’ve used with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Day

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed With Power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old Mighty Mite, which probably lasted 20+ years and is losing suction. Well, this new model has less power than my old veteran. I tried changing bags, checking for any blockages in the hose, making sure the ring was closed and that everything was hooked up correctly. It will still barely pick up any scattered kitty litter. On top of that, the price just dropped by about 20 bucks. It's going to be a pain to send this back.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry R.

customer_reviews.title: Love this sweeper!
customer_reviews.text: Went from carpeting to total laminate floors with two incredibly shedding dogs.....this was a lifesaver! Powerful little vacuum, takes care of my area rugs very well also. Two things I dislike; 1. Hose is flimsy and easy crimps, shutting off flow, 2. The wand sections just slide together (no buttons to secure) so they occasionally come apart during a cleaning frenzy! It is a fine little machine!
customer_reviews.author: Gail R.

customer_reviews.title: Doss the job of 3 hairy dogs
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing I Purchased it because I have three Saint Bernard’s in my Dyson keeps breaking after two or three years this little thing is absolutely wonderful on any floor that does not have carpet it will work on carpet but not like a regular vacuum it’s great to just pull around the house when you want to clean up hair or dust bunnies I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Fawn VonGunten

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use/good for quick cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I have an AIRBNB and I use this for cleaning between guests. As an older person I found other vacuums too heavy. This is not for heavy-duty but for cleaning on a day to day basis. Does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Faustina DuBois

customer_reviews.title: But this little canister is freaking amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, my expectations were not high, I admit. But this little canister is freaking amazing!!! My house is hardwood throughout with memory foam rugs here and there. The hose is smaller in diameter than a $400 model.. But it's not meant to be a shop vac..I have had this canister for over a year. It's light weight. The hepa filter works perfectly! Nothing escapes this little beauty.. It's perfect for floors, furniture, you name it! It has great and consistent suction! And for a vacuum, it's really quiet. I can vacuum anytime and not worry about disturbing my neighbors..I hate vacuuming but maybe a little less now. Thanks for a great product and septic!
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Built to break.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for less than 7 months and the start button has broken. I have to plug and unplug it from the wall socket to turn it on and off. The motor is good but the canister is junky plastic . I would not recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Absolute worst vacuum I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Use on carpets?? Doesn't pick up a thing. I totally wasted my money. I have to have another vacuum if I want my carpets clear of pet hair. It gets better. When I tried to use it on the stairs, the stair cleaner brush snapped off. This is by far the most useless vacuum I have ever bought and I will Never buy another Eureka again. Piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Sue - SC

customer_reviews.title: No longer a good product. Cheap plastic garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned one of these vacuums for my entire adult life. I loved the versatility and function of the product. Sad to say this will be my last purchase, because they are now total junk. The plastic hose kinks so badly it was unusable and had to be replaced immediately after purchase. The floor attachment does not work well on carpet, and less than one year after purchasing, the on/off switch broke. Eureka will not cover it under warranty. They want me to buy the switch from somewhere across the country and install it myself! Goodbye Eureka!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Bradley

customer_reviews.title: great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this vacuum for a little over a year. In the past I have purchased vacuums from $60 to $300 and never like one as much as this one. I have 90% hardwood floors and with dogs, birds and 2 people with long hair it is a must. 😃 The Pros: Good suction Lightweight Can get under low objects. (couch, loveseat) When bag get full does not loose suction. No brushes or rollers to get knotted up with hair. (That is a BIG deal for me) The Cons: The cord holder (it sucks, no pun intended) Is does get very warm. (But have never had and issues) The hose can kink at time. ( not a deal breaker)
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe good reviews; cheaply made garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe good reviews. This vacuum was so cheaply made and ineffective we returned it on day 1. Hose instantly kinks and would surely have torn within a month. Main cleaning head constantly fell off of extension wand ( wand is only metal part) and hose fell off of wand. No attention at all paid to size tolerances. Wheels showed wear after single use. Also underpowered. Eureka is neither mighty, nor fit for use by pet lovers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark 459

customer_reviews.title: Wheels break off
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these vacuums in the past 3 years and, while the suction is still okay, the wheels have all broken off. I tried to glue them back on but they break right back off. Having no wheels causes hot air to blow strongly out of the vents around the where the wheel is supposed to be and pulling the vacuum body around without wheels causes scratches on the finish of wood floors. I had a Sanitaire with the same exact design as these Mighty Mites and the wheels broke off of it also. Am getting ready to order a Bissell. Hopefully it will hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good little sweeper
customer_reviews.text: So far o good. I like this little cleaner. I have hardwood floors and a few rugs and it works on both. Hasn't scratched my hardwood. I have a Long Haired-Old Time GSD, a Long Haired Black Lab, And a mutt. All in and outdoor. This little vaccuum does the job. I even went behind it with my other one and didn't pick up anything new. It could use a longer cord though and the attachments fall off a lot at first, but they seem to find their niche and then they're fine.
customer_reviews.author: Karen H.

customer_reviews.title: I am delighted with the suction and the lighter weight of this ...
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with the suction and the lighter weight of this vacuum. Didn't care for the metal arm that attaches to the sweeper head and also didn't like the sweeper head. The metal arm adds too much weight and the head is bulky and weighty and also didn't pick up well. So I simply ordered two extra extension arms which fit fine and also ordered at 12 inch floor brush - voila! I now have what I want - light weight and not bulky little vacuum with suction. The extras were worth it and makes the vacuum just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Rising Moon

customer_reviews.title: Loved this little vacuum but the switch broke
customer_reviews.text: The switch is cheaply built and broke after 8 months. Hopefully I can get it replaced under warranty. I do love the vacuum and the price is right. It was recommended by my housekeeper who has one of her own but told me the stitches break so this must be a design issue.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT LITTLE SWEEPER!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little sweeper! It is light weight and easier for this older gal to haul or roll around! Has GREAT suction! Highly recommends to others who want a light weight sweeper that has the suction and gets the job done. It doesn't have a retractable cord, but doesn't matter to me for the cord is a heavy duty LONG cord.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Tonjes

customer_reviews.title: Great until it stops
customer_reviews.text: Had this since May. It’s a fantastic little vacuum until it stops working. I change bags every week because I have two cats and two dogs. The suction suddenly stopped one day. Tried everything to fix it and nothing worked. For the price I really was expecting it to last a year. Terribly disappointed, especially since I just bought more bags and filters
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Might Mite and we love it. The one this replaces is 29 years old and still runs great but it needs to retire. I am very pleased this one has a HEPA filter and I love how the bags are designed with the tab to cover the dust hole so dust doesn't escape when changing. The HEPA filter was very easy to install. This is so important because I have asthma. Another feature we love is the adjustable wand. We are tall and this helps save our backs. Very easy to adjust. The vacuum is very powerful. We have pets and hardwood floors so a good vacuum is extremely important. This is a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy WebBuilder

customer_reviews.title: Great 12 amp vacuum
customer_reviews.text: 12 amp, The vacuum has good suction but the hand tools easily come off when vacuuming which makes it a pain. You have to constantly put them back on. Especially floor tool when vacuuming carpet as you bring it back toward you it falls off. Needs to have a locking device. If you open suction a little on wand the tools stay on better. This one is 12 amp, very powerful suction.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: I love this vacuum...
customer_reviews.text: Love the Mighty Mite. I've used this vacuum exclusively for years. Its small, hides away nicely, suction is awesome (sometimes you can't pry it away from what you're vacuuming without popping the vent valve), and the HEPA filter is a must for a person with allergies and asthma. The room really feels clean after you vacuum with this.
customer_reviews.author: CantBleevBowiesGone

customer_reviews.title: Dog hair plugs hose wand
customer_reviews.text: We bought it to clean areas that our upright could not reach. We have a dog who is sheds. The little tufts of hair continually clogged the hose wand where it has about a 20 degree bend. This is unacceptable for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Loved My First Mighty Mite. Hate the New One.
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed this vacuum cleaner more than two years ago and couldn't say enough good things about it. I literally wore it out and after two years thought I deserved to buy a new one. I have to say I am disappointed in my new Mighty Mite. Obviously, Eureka felt it necessary to improve on a "good thing." And the result is a vacuum cleaner with less suction and overall poor performance. The wand is forever getting clogged up and the newly designed vacuum attachment (with its flip switch for wood floors) doesn't work well on carpets or floors. I wish I could figure out how Eureka managed to mess up what was once the perfect lightweight vac.
customer_reviews.author: A. Minton

customer_reviews.title: Great on furniture and pet hair
customer_reviews.text: Love that it's lightweight. It's maneuvers very well and just great! I don't have stairs (apt dweller) so can't attest to that but sure it's fine - just use the attachments.
customer_reviews.author: hallimos

customer_reviews.title: Great little canister vac
customer_reviews.text: Mighty Mite was my first vacuum cleaner and has always been my main vacuum cleaner. I had one that failed after several years, another that got left behind in a move, and now I have this model. For a low-end canister vac, the Mighty Mite has always been durable and very powerful. It doesn't take up much closet space, it's easy to carry around, and it's good enough for all my household needs. This particular model is very similar in quality and performance to the previous ones I've owned, but with improved attachments (including a nifty brush roll attachment) and a HEPA filter. I have never really found the need for a fancier vacuum cleaner than the aptly-named Mighty Mite.
customer_reviews.author: PlaysWithFire

customer_reviews.title: Meh....
customer_reviews.text: Works well on hard wood or tile, but that is no feat for a vacuum IMHO. Fails on carpet. Stores the cord in the undercarriage between the wheels, so to wrap it all up, user needs to turn the whole thing over.... It sits in the closet now and the Shark Lifttaway gets the work out.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Like that it's lightweight, good for stairs, upholstery and high volume spots, good suction. Would pay more if there were changes: on/off button on unit rather than pipe; brush too lightweight for regular vacuuming, hard on back (which is why I wanted a lightweight vacuum) exhaust opening keeps opening as it's positioned where you hold the pipe; pet hair attachment small, works on spots but not general cleaning; because it's lightweight, unit rolls over when pulled around; needs retractable cord. Will probably buy another vacuum for general cleaning and keep this for stairs. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cars1

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this specifically for cleaning a hard floor around cat litter boxes. It does a great job and is easier than using a broom and dust pan. Very powerful, light weight, easy to change bags. The hose is a little awkward feeling. But for someone who hates vacuum cleaners with a passion, I use this one daily and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Nothing good about this vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Horrible suction. The handle or wand (the part you actually hold while you are vacuuming) has a gap that keeps opening, preventing suction, and it pinches your hand if you are not aware of it. I had to tape it so it would not keep opening. No idea what the purpose of this "feature" is. The hose constantly gets bent or tangled and you have to stop and untangle it before it will start suction again. It works "okay" on hardwoods, but on carpet, don't even bother. Just a total wast of money in my opinion. I wish I had tried to return it earlier, but now it's too late.
customer_reviews.author: karen wheeler

customer_reviews.title: along with the accessory parts falling off easily. For me
customer_reviews.text: I see other posts complaining about how the tubing gets kinked or twisted, along with the accessory parts falling off easily. For me, I do not have these issues. If you pay attention to the hose and untwist it if it starts to kink you won't have a problem and it will not create a permanent kink if you do not store it inappropriately. Also, the accessory parts go on perfectly and if you add a little pressure then twist, they stay on and do not fall off. It has great suction and it reaches to high ceilings . This is a great little vacuum for a low price.
customer_reviews.author: 💗Nurse Beth💗

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Eureka canister vacuum I have had. The first lasted about 15 years and I liked it so much that when the motor finally burnt out, I purchased a new "pet version." I had it for approximately four months and it no longer works. The motor smells like it is burning, the sides are super hot and the suction is basically gone (and yes it has a new bag in it). Very disappointed and apparently the quality of the product just isn't the same but I would expect more than four months use out of it. Before it died, it did work great though.
customer_reviews.author: amelia48

customer_reviews.title: But it has great (supper) suction and the pet brush attachment really works
customer_reviews.text: I give it 3 stars because the metal extension tube is very heavy (I have another MM but it came with a plastic tube). The metal tube pulls out of the plastic hose when ever you pull it towards you on carpet, even on my tile floors. Almost every time. Metal hitting tile really makes for a loud crash. But it has great (supper) suction and the pet brush attachment really works. I've taped the tube and handle together which solved the detachment problem but it is still very heavy. I may go online and order the plastic tube.
customer_reviews.author: special ed

customer_reviews.title: One thing would make it perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is no doubt the best vaccuum I have ever had for pet hair. We have 4 dogs and a cat so our hard wood floors and furniture look like they are growing fur. This has great attachments and the suction is phenomenal. The only thing I would do to make this a better vaccuum is to add some sort of locking mechanism to the floor attachment as it tends to come off easily while you are cleaning. A minor adjustment would make this the "Perfect Vaccuum". We are amazed at the suction, the long handle fits easily under all our furniture and the long extension cord make moving around a snap!
customer_reviews.author: donnagay1950

customer_reviews.title: Very good at getting into tight places and the long reach ...
customer_reviews.text: This model replaces a larger Eureka upright model. Very good at getting into tight places and the long reach provided by the hose is excellent. Works great on both carpets and hardwood floors. Suction power is great like the Eureka upright it replaced. Far better than most other brands I've used over the years. The only minor negative with this model is that the cleaning head tends to come off a bit easily when doing deep piled rugs. Other than that, this is an great vacuum cleaner. Light, powerful suction and great reach.
customer_reviews.author: Paul323

customer_reviews.title: Odd problem
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum works alright but for one odd problem. It came with heavy metal wands that don't seem meant to go with the everything else is plastic light vacuum cleaner. They are nice sturdy wands but they seem to be meant to go with a different and heavier vacuum cleaner. As it is, the plastic floor attachment kept falling off the metal wands when I vacuumed. I have an old Mighty Mite and I took the wands from the old vacuum and put them on this new one. They match fine and the floor attachment stays on.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum meets expectations for hardwood floors and stairs, porcelain tile, grout joints and car interiors plus the attachment for pet hair and upholstery fabric is superb. Other benefits are the vacuum is designed for easy wand adjustments, suction settings also for changing the disposable bag and exhaust filter. However the underside chord storage is a bit awkward so we wrap it onto itself over the handle The entire vacuum with wand, hoses and brushes is lightweight, easy to hand carry with no awkward balancing act needed.
customer_reviews.author: Retired in Texas

customer_reviews.title: 3 times - Already Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Suction stopped. At first I thought it was an awesome product. Then it stopped being awesome. No suction and I checked every place I can for a possible clog to clear. No clog found.
customer_reviews.author: Patti B.

customer_reviews.title: Eureka Mighty Mite
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this vacuum for 10 years. It's light weight, it's very portable, and it's great in a big house with pets. I even gave my husband one for work. He's a carpenter and always needs something to do a quick clean up, and this works so much better than a big, huge shop vac. I have two dogs and two cats and only rugs (no carpet) and I just couldn't live without this vacuum. Being older, I just don't have the strength to lug around a big heavy machine, and I rarely use my very expensive upright anymore. Perfect gift for someone in a small space (or big space). Even bought a second one for my studio.
customer_reviews.author: TeriSue

customer_reviews.title: Very nice vaccume.
customer_reviews.text: This vaccume has some serious power! I do not have a pet but I decided to pay a few bucks more for this 12 amp version onf the Mighty Might with the hepa filter and I am very pleased. I feel like the purple color is darker than the online picture represents too. Very nice. Buy an extra floor BRUSH attachment to complete the package.
customer_reviews.author: B$

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vacuum in July of 2015 and used it weekly for normal clean up on wood floors. In September of 2015, I had a flea issue and started to use this daily to get rid of the fleas. A week and a half into this, the vacuum just died. I had to run out and buy a new vacuum that night. Wound up with a Kenmore and, although heavier than this vacuum, it works much better and is way more powerful. only thing is i have a replacement filter which is still brand newand probably some bags, and amazon only takes items back for 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Donna E Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted 5 months, also hose very flimsy gets crimped and loses suction
customer_reviews.author: bogger

customer_reviews.title: Decent vacuum ruined by cheap hose.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a pretty decent small lightweight inexpensive vacuum, but it has one fault which I find infuriating. The hose is cheap, and kinks easily. It kinks pretty much any time you twist the hose, which happens frequently in the course of normal vacuuming, and now after a couple years of use it has permanent kinks at both ends of the hose causing it to kink even more easily than new. I wish I could get a heavier replacement hose, because it would be a great vacuum then.
customer_reviews.author: Matte Brittenham

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is a great value. It has great suction and the floor attachments glides very smoothly on the floor. The part where the hose attaches to the canister swivels, which is nice, but it feels a little flimsy. The tube extensions are a nice solid metal and the hose where it attaches to the tubes is plastic and sometimes there isn't enough friction to keep the two coupled. It's annoying, but doesn't happen often enough for me to knock a star off, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cleaning up after dogs that shed!
customer_reviews.text: Great for pet hair. My husky dog sheds so much. This vacuum is perfect for my hardwood floors, couch, tile floors, baseboards, curtains, under furniture, etc. Great attachments! Doesn’t smell like dog when I turn it on (my upright canister vacuum does!). Good price. Bought on Amazon Prime Day.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Love love love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum, its lightweight and awesome suction. First time I used it, the suction stopped because i was picking up any and everything and it got caught up in the head, I then figured out use without the head for hair ball clumps and other big things, have not had a problem since, if suction stops its because something is stopped up in the hose. This little machine is killer and it just follows behind you as you go around the house. i only have to pick it up when I go upstairs. Its an awesome machine and its even better that it was under $90.
customer_reviews.author: Steph Renee Prime

customer_reviews.title: Mislead by other reviews or faulty machine....who knows?
customer_reviews.text: The box looked taped up, the parts were all loose, the hose is so cheap it seems like it will constantly almost tear when it folds in half, it's hard to store in my pantry due to size/shape, the suction is not amazing, it does an ok job on my rugs, not great, perhaps I received a damaged item, but working in a hospice nursing bedside for months at a time, I had no way to cope with the return. So, not happy at all, but stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: TheeMissM

customer_reviews.title: The hoses and tube do not fit
customer_reviews.text: I just opened my box , because an older vacuum stopped working. The hose , piping that goes together to the wand, do not fit. And like I said, I love the little mighty mites, I have had two , so ordered a spare. I need the correct pieces tk u l
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Sad to send it back as it is cute and light, but back it goes!
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this after using it twice. The hose and parts are so cheaply made, the short cleaning path made it kind of worthless, and the cleaning path tool (the part that fits on the end) didn't roll when I pushed it to vacuum, it stuck and scraped. The dog hair stuck to the bristles and stopped the suction action rendering it pretty much useless unless I stopped every pass to clean it off. Very disappointing as I had such high hopes!
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Queen

customer_reviews.title: After using this for about 2 months I’d have to say I’m very happy with this purchase and would recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptacal to purchase this vacuume but was in desperate need of a vacuume for my stairs and couches. After using this for about 2 months I’d have to say I’m very happy with this purchase and would recommend this to anyone. I’ve actually stopped using my expensive vacuume on my hardwood floors and started using the Eureka. The suction is phenomenal!!
customer_reviews.author: SAMCRO

customer_reviews.title: The best vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this many many years ago Great value The best vacuum ever owned Still operating as new
customer_reviews.author: A Z

customer_reviews.title: Quite satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Remarkably powerful suction and "tracks" reasonably well. Serves its purpose well. Unfortunately the auction does not translate into power for the blower; I feel like it has much less power when used in that capacity (which seems counterintuitive, because the airflow should be the same...) Could be user error of some sort; I will post an update if I'm able to figure out a way to get improved performance for the blower function.
customer_reviews.author: Kara G.

customer_reviews.title: Great little canister vac
customer_reviews.text: Good suction for such a small canister vac. Like the HEPA filter which can be easily removed and replaced. Haven't used the pet brush yet, but looks promising. The expandable wand is great. Needs a better floor brush and not wild about the combined dust/upholstery attachment, else I would have rated this purchase a 5 star. Still hard to find a better value!
customer_reviews.author: Neal D

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't easy on it by any means
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Eureka mity mite for over 20 years that finally passed on to vacuum heaven. I wasn't easy on it by any means.Over the years a few mechanical things died and my husband found parts on line and repaired it because I didnt want to part with it. Finally I knew it was time to let it go lol,,,,, and ordered a new one.It's soo easy to drag around the house,easy to store and the suction power is great! I hope this one lasts as long as my last.I also just order my supply of replacent bags online to last me.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Nokes

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy set up, doesn't sound like a 747. It has lots of power. The extra pet attachment is great for upholstry even without a pet. I have all hardwood floors so can't tell you how it works on carpets. I think it would need a power nozzle to be most effective for carpeting. One really nice feature is the telescoping wand. It makes it just the right height for comfort and then can reach those high, cobweb corners. The swivel nozzle can really get very flat for getting under low furniture. I also think the hose is a bit on the flimsy side, so I'm careful not to let it crimp. That's my only con.
customer_reviews.author: Bonpierce

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum work pretty good it does get hot around the motor but my easy clean 2 gets a little warm too . So I figure its just the motor working hard and my carpets are dirty we have 3 cats and a 180 to 200 pound black lab mix so pet dander and odor are strong plus 3 people and nieces and nephews there is a lot foot traffic .I will update my review if anything odd happens or if it over heats. Also compare to my eureka easy clean 2 the mighty mite is a lot better and has a hepa filter
customer_reviews.author: jimmy p

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t seem to have good suction for carpets
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. Didn’t seem to have good suction for carpets. Maybe I missed a recommendation for low pile carpets or hardwood floors but this didn’t seem to do much for me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Good hard floor quicky vacuum
customer_reviews.text: It is loud and it is a paper bag, but I like the power. It comes with hepa filter that catches the exhaust, but I am not using it. I think it will lead to overheated motor. Some reviews talks about the heat. Actually the vacuum body and the exhaust air became cooler longer I ran it. I can't explain it. Initial start heat or paper bag filling out? This comes with one piece metal tube - heavy. It also has air driven brush head. I could slow down the brush with my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: ventingisok

customer_reviews.title: not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: poor features - all Black design model is ugly. disappointed in other features. no place to hang hose/store etc. cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: mbmoto

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use - Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Parts would fall off when vacuuming. Canister was hot to the touch after just a short while. Too many parts - not easy. Bought it for my new wood floors but did not like it. Worried I was scratching the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Papa and Grandma Carol

customer_reviews.title: No beater bar on the vacuum head...
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum could be ok if you don’t need to vacuum carpet ever...to me it had good suction but no beater brush at the head or even a turbo brush roll made it virtually useless...it did have the turbo ‘pet paw’ attachment which I tested and it was ok.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie 333

customer_reviews.title: At first glance.....
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to receive this vacuum today as one of my dogs just recently started a shed cycle again. It worked very well on the first attempt at using it but the pet hair attachment "paw" clogged immediately and I spent more time removing the clogged hair then vacuuming. I also have a nasty blood blister on my hand from the sliding ring that is on the wand attachment. Very easy to pinch your skin as it's right where you hold the wand. This may be going back!
customer_reviews.author: Jules66

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Inexpensive, lightweight, excellent suction with the main attachment (pictured) and the crevice attachment. Works brilliantly on wooden floors and tile, and almost too well on rugs (lifts them off the floor) Cons: I still get tangled with the the hose, wheels are plastic rather than rubber and I fear they may scratch the floors, the paw attachment doesn't seem much use on my sofa (other tools are better) and the metal extension to the hose falls off the plastic part every now and then, so perhaps the seal could be better. Overall great value for money though.
customer_reviews.author: Swsie

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Suction power decreased after only a few months and after 1 year, wiring started to be problematic and vacuum started having power issues. Certainly not worth $80. Go with another, better brand!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes! Buy this!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE BEST PET VACUUM! Omg ok so I have two dogs and there is hair all over the house and couch. This small, yet powerful, vacuum gets my house together...under the bed, between the couch cushions, and I even use it instead of sweeping my bathroom. This little vacuum is everything!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight vacuum with a lot of suction.
customer_reviews.text: Use mainly for laminate flooring and carpeted stairs. Does a great job on the laminate, light weight great when doing the stairs. Hose does come apart sometimes when using full suction, but easily put back together. Head for upholstery and stairs is stored separately from the rest of the vacuum. Great suction for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D

customer_reviews.text: After much research I decided on the Eureka Mighty Mite Pet Lover vacuum for quick pickups when I did not want to haul out and wrestle with the long hose on our internal vacuum. For that purpose it is great and I love powerful suction. What I do not like are the toys they sent calling them attachments. What a joke! Luckily, the attachments are universal so the ones from my whole house vacuum fit.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest Gal

customer_reviews.title: perfect for stairs and other tight areas
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to vacuum our steep stairs and other tight spaces. Super light weight, good suction.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Mighty for its size!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very strong vac for its size. Light in weight makes it easy to handle. Found the cord to be better than the last vac we had, but needed to be about 8' longer. I would commend it to anyone needing a smaller size vac and or has a bad back. It is easy/light to use and store away, but is does the job of a large vac.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight P.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the ON-OFF Switch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first MightMite vacuum in 1996 and it lasted 20 years. In August 2016, I purchased the new Pet Model specifically designed for vacuuming pet hair. It lasted 2 years before the switch broke off the vacuum. I purchased two more of the same model in August 2018 and the same On-Off switch broke again in two months. Eureka's a quality product, but for some reason, they need to redesign the switch. I'm dealing with Eureka Warranty - I'll let you know how they honor their product.
customer_reviews.author: Avi8torPAO

customer_reviews.title: awesome vacuum. It maybe a little loud but it ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow....awesome vacuum. It maybe a little loud but it works great. The suction on it is strong picks up anything. Be careful with your hands in the little suction opening. You can adjusted for the pressure. I always had upright vacuums but not anymore, I'm a believer now an have switch for the better. You do have to use different accessories for area rugs. I use the pet/upholstery one so it doesn't pull rug as I clean it. For hardwood floors I bought a different attachment that has more of a brush/bristle on both sides so it doesn't scratch floors. The one that came with vacuum is good but doesn't have much bristle n scratch my floor.
customer_reviews.author: latin2621

customer_reviews.title: On/off switch inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother! Unless you’re handy and want to fix the on/off switch (which requires removing 4 screws and removing backend of vacuum and repositioning switch) The press to push on/off plastic is a bit to rigid to switch off or on, depending of position. You got to propt up the plastic a lil bit to disengage switch. A total inconvenience. Obviously. Thanks, Eureka
customer_reviews.author: Julio F.

customer_reviews.title: Suction Weak After Two Uses
customer_reviews.text: Returned this. I used it twice and the suction was great the first time, ok the second. When I tried it a third time it was already weak. And it doesn't have spinning brushes in the actual main attachment, which you'd think would be a must for any vacuum with the word "Pet" in the title. Cheaper than many, but ultimately you're better off paying more for something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: I like the size of this vacuum cleaner
customer_reviews.text: 1. I like the size of this vacuum cleaner. 2. The wand does not have a built in button to secure it in place, it just pushes together. The wand has come apart and dropped on my foot a few times. It does have good suction. There is a hole in the top of the wand that can be covered or opened to regulate the suction. 3. I wish the company would make a better floor brush (more bristles) for picking up fine dust. 4. One of the extra attachment is a small brush which is made into two brushes, one side with bristles and the other side not bristles. The bulk of it made it useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: susan m

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Mighty Mites over the years and only one of them actually died (after at least 10 years of regular use). I love them because they are lightweight and don't lose suction. This time I upgraded a few bucks to the pet lover version and it is the BEST of all. The rigid part of the hose is sturdier and more stable, the wide floor head works better on carpet than the older versions, the pet hair attachment has an excellent rotating brush, and the unit comes with a snap-on optional hepa filter. Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: MSanto

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I use this vacuum in the office.because my boss sometimes brings his dog to work, and then there is hair on the couch and carpet. This takes the hair right out, it's pretty amazing. I think it uses some sort of static electricity technology or something, because pet hair just clings to the vacuum. It has some trouble picking up larger, heavier bits of debris, but it picks up the majority of stuff. Strongly recommend this vacuum, especially if you have pets.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier T. Guillaume

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn't be listed as Pet lovers Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum based on ratings and what other people had to say about it. This vacuum does okay. I do like that it can fit in hard to reach places and that it is light weight but I don't recommend for households with pets. It just doesn't pick up the hair at all (which is the reason I bought it). It gets most of the dirt off the carpet and the suction is great on low profile carpets. I am just a little disappointed about the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Luvr2502

customer_reviews.title: Love this vac
customer_reviews.text: this is really powerful,yet lightweight. Assortment of nozzles takes care of even carpeted stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: We love this vacuum
customer_reviews.text: We love this vacuum. It's efficient, light weight, inexpensive and strong. It really does the job. We have a large house and have to clean rooms constantly for short term guests. It's easy to carry, set up, use and return to its storage space. We've had them for over a year and they're going strong, and we use them constantly. We especially like the hepa filter which helps us reduce allergens. dragonflyhill.wordpress.com
customer_reviews.author: DragonflyHill Urban Farm

customer_reviews.title: Rated 3 instead of 5
customer_reviews.text: This canister has very good suction, which I love. It also has great attachments especially the pet power paw for stairs and upholstery which works great! The problem I have with it is the vacuum hose, which is very cheaply made and constantly bends and blocks the suction. If it had a more well made hose I would have rated it 5 instead of 3.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisoola

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but cleans like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This is a small apartment-sized vacuum with incredible power. You will go crazy trying to figure where to store the wands and hose and miscellanea -- I ended up using a plastic bucket I had lying around, the heck with esthetics -- but once you plug it in and use it, you will be delighted. I have a much more expensive vacuum in my main house and it doesn't pick up as well. Best sucker for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Ladner

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we have two dogs who shed a lot and a dust mop just wasn't doing the job! Also, I had just had rotator cuff surgery so the upright vac was too much for me to handle. The Mighty Mite is very handy, light enough for me to pull, and has great suction! The turbo attachment for furniture is awesome! I highly recommend this canister vac! The only negative is that the cord could be longer... and retractable would be handy!
customer_reviews.author: RJL

customer_reviews.title: Despite the lack of a good head for carpet
customer_reviews.text: We have an animal rescue, and our home has multiple cats and dogs. This vacuum meets my needs extremely well, however, it doesn't have a motorized head...so it doesn't work as well on rugs. There is an upholstery tool that has a rotating brush, and it is quite effective, but I can't imagine using it on an entire carpeted room. Despite the lack of a good head for carpet, I think it's a great vacuum. It's a good value, and I would recommend it. This vendor is very good...it arrived on time, and in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome suction but plastic parts are pet hair magnets!
customer_reviews.text: Really powerful suction! Only wish the floor brush would spin like the furniture attachment does. But overall all happy for the price that I paid. I had to reduce my rating due to an issue this vacuum has. It's a pet vacuum so I consider it a major flaw that the plastic hose and floor attachments attract so much pet hair due to static electricity. I never had this issue with any other vacuum. I actually have to clean the vacuum when I finish vacuuming.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: There is no beater brush for carpets. It doesn't pick up anything on carpets. The suction section is a mere 4" wide, not the whole width of the attachment. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this for doggie owners
customer_reviews.text: This does NOT suck up my dog's fur. I also have issues with its hose, which bends and then has no suction at all. I would not recommend this for rugs that have dogs on them (my dogs are on my throw rugs all the time). It also scratches wood floors really badly, unless you flip a piece on the base to make it rest higher, which basically causes the vacuum to pick up .... nothing. It glides over dust and dog treats as if I am not vacuuming.
customer_reviews.author: My Hummel OpinionTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as older mighty mite
customer_reviews.text: Liked my old mighty mite better. It works better if you take off the hepa filter (hepa filter doesn't stop any particles). I've had the old mighty mite for 20 years and it is actually quieter and more power.
customer_reviews.author: Fear no Fish

customer_reviews.title: This is a handy portable vacuum. Powerful enough. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy portable vacuum. Powerful enough. Annoyances: Wand is friction-fit and keeps separating while using. You tend to want to pick it up on the end so you grab the hose. Likely to break. It could use a grab bar on the hose end.
customer_reviews.author: Ponchojuan

customer_reviews.title: Just okay.
customer_reviews.text: It is just okay, nothing special. This vacuum make a lot of noise and frankly, lack in the suction. It does a great job on hardwood floor and tiles, but not great on low compact carpet. I got it for the old house and use my better, more power vacuum [the M name brand -German] for the real house. I strongly dislike the long handle and hose as they are rather annoying and gets in the way of moving around tables, chairs, sofas, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dsunfish2000

customer_reviews.title: Doe's not pick up dog hair on carpets
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 dogs . This vaccum works great on hardwood floors but does nothing for my carpet even with attachment. My carpet is still full of dog hair.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Giles

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum is fantastic if you have pets
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is fantastic if you have pets. With our eskie there are a LOT of little eskie fluffs everywhere. I vacuum 2-3 times a week and the suction is still great. I was worried about going back to a bagged vacuum, but with my allergies it has been a live saver. I don't have to mess with dumping anything out or accidentally getting it on myself. Everything is contained in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Super Awesome Lady

customer_reviews.title: ... has a lot of power and it does a good job. I don't have a pet
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has a lot of power and it does a good job. I don't have a pet, but I used it at my daughter's home where they have a dog that sheds a lot. It did a great job getting up the hair. I would recommend it to others. The only reason I didn't give it a 5-star rating is because the hose is a bit flimsy compared to my old small canister vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: a real deal
customer_reviews.text: We owned our last Mighty Mite for over 12 years, and it was still working, but many of the plastic parts ( hoses, wheels, casing, cord, attachments) were at the end of their useful life after much daily use. The new unit works even better and was less expensive than our original purchase. I didn't want to spend a lot of money for a pet vac, and this definitely is the best $$ value going. Highly recommend this unit at the online price of around $70 !!
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good machine for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine little machine. Gets under furniture, good suction, reaches walls and ceilings and the bags are easy to change.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This sucks....NOT!
customer_reviews.text: It's probably good enough as an electric broom, but it doesn't do well enough on rugs or carpet. I like that it's compact, but having to unravel and wind up the cord is getting tiresome. Wish it had the retractable cord --- that would have enhanced its functionality. But as far as a vacuum cleaner, this sucks....NOT!
customer_reviews.author: PCD

product_meta.title: EUREKA Mighty Mite Bagged Canister Vacuum Cleaner, Pet, 3684f-violet
product_meta.description: 3684F Features: -Mighty mite collection. -Black and Blue color. Color: -Black, blue. Material: -Metal/Plastic. Dimensions: Overall Height - Top to Bottom: -18". Overall Width - Side to Side: -6". Overall Depth - Front to Back: -6". Overall Product Weight: -16. 9 lbs.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,520 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Eureka Mighty Mite Pet Lover, Combination Tool, Deluxe Floor Nozzle, 2-Year Manufacturer's Warranty, Crevice Tool, 3684F
